verses.verse: Let him kiss <WH5401> me with the kisses <WH5390> of his mouth <WH6310>; For thy love <WH1730> is better <WH2896> than wine <WH3196>.
Thine oils <WH8081> have a goodly <WH2896> fragrance <WH7381>; Thy name <WH8034> is as oil <WH8081> poured forth <WH7324>; Therefore do the virgins <WH5959> love thee <WH157>.

Draw <WH4900> me <WH7323>; we will run after <WH310> thee <WH4428>: The king hath brought <WH935> me into his chambers <WH2315>; We will be glad <WH1523> and rejoice <WH8055> in thee <WH2142>; We will make mention of thy love <WH1730> more than of wine <WH3196>: Rightly <WH4339> do they love thee <WH157>.
I am black <WH7838>, but comely <WH5000>, Oh ye daughters <WH1323> of Jerusalem <WH3389>, As the tents <WH168> of Kedar <WH6938>, As the curtains <WH3407> of Solomon <WH8010>.

Look <WH7200> not upon me <WH7840>, because I am swarthy, Because the sun <WH8121> hath scorched <WH7805> me <WH517>. My mother's sons <WH1121> were incensed <WH2787> against me <WH7760>; They made me keeper <WH5201> of the vineyards <WH3754>; But mine own vineyard <WH3754> have I not kept <WH5201>.

Tell <WH5046> me <WH5315>, O thou whom my soul loveth <WH157>, Where <WH349> thou feedest <WH7462> thy flock <WH349>, Where thou makest it to rest <WH7257> at noon <WH6672>: For <WH4100> why should I be as one that is veiled Beside the flocks <WH5739> of thy companions <WH2270>?

If thou know <WH3045> not <WH3303>, O thou fairest among women <WH802>, Go thy way forth <WH3318> by the footsteps <WH6119> of the flock <WH6629>, And feed <WH7462> thy kids <WH1429> beside the shepherds <WH7462>' tents <WH4908>.
I have compared <WH1819> thee <WH7474>, O my love, To a steed <WH5484> in Pharaoh <WH6547>'s chariots <WH7393>.
Thy cheeks <WH3895> are comely <WH4998> with plaits <WH8447> of hair <WH6677>, Thy neck with strings of jewels <WH2737>.
We will make <WH6213> thee plaits <WH8447> of gold <WH2091> With studs <WH5351> of silver <WH3701>.
While the king <WH4428> sat at his table <WH4524>, My spikenard <WH5373> sent forth <WH5414> its fragrance <WH7381>.
My beloved <WH1730> is unto me as a bundle <WH6872> of myrrh <WH4753>, That lieth <WH3885> betwixt my breasts <WH7699>.
My beloved <WH1730> is unto me as a cluster <WH811> of henna-flowers <WH3724> In the vineyards <WH3754> of En-gedi <WH5872>.
Behold <WH3303>, thou art fair, my love <WH7474>; Behold thou art fair <WH3303>; Thine eyes <WH5869> are as doves <WH3123>.
Behold <WH3303>, thou art fair, my beloved <WH1730>, yea <WH5273>, pleasant: Also our couch <WH6210> is green <WH7488>.
The beams <WH6982> of our house <WH1004> are cedars <WH730>, And our rafters <WH7351> are firs <WH1266>.
